intro: Selinum wallichianum, commonly known as the Himalayan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and often emit a mild, spicy odor. It is adapted to cold, mountainous environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
